title: 820 3115, no green light
message:
Hey, 

working on 3115 board with no green light. No signals Liquid damage, board very clean! 

PPBUS = 12.30V
PP3V42_G3H = 3.42V
PPVRTC_G3H = 3.4V
PP5V_S5 = 0.42V - No short 430v - Diode_mod 
PP5V_SUS = 0V

already reflow SMC - no changes 

already test with power supply on this board and consumes only 0.008A.. 

ideas?? TPS51125 problem?? i don't do anything on this board i need the right direction. 

thank you

title: 820 3115, no green light
message:
"PPBUS = 12.30V"
Incorrect, SMC doesn't talk with ISL6259.
Check first SMC_RESET_L.

title: 820 3115, no green light
message:
SMC_RESET_L = 3.449V 
SMC_BC_acok = 3.4V
sys_onwire = 3.4V
adapter_sense = 3.4V
SMC_PM_G2_EN = 0.133V
SMC_ADAPTER_EN = 0V

title: 820 3115, no green light
message:
"SMC_PM_G2_EN = 0.133V"
SMC issue, so change it.
You can try to reball it first...

title: 820 3115, no green light
message:
Already reballing SMC and replaced for a donor board!! Same history.. PPBus still 12.32V! Probably this SMC it's Bad!! there's something else I can do before I replace to another one?? 

thanks

title: 820 3115, no green light
message: Check basic voltages and signals for SMC, U4900 (2 of 2) at page 45.

title: 820 3115, no green light
message: Yes check basic voltages. Also doesn't hurt to try a new ISL as well, but this sounds like a bad SMC.

title: 820 3115, no green light
message:
ok, while checking the basic signals first point i was checked BANG !!  L4901 was moved!! heheh

[url]https://drive.google.com/file/d/15VXX9gZCkA0bvnWEhiTwMkGRXQpgGyTl/view?usp=sharing[/url]

Now i have PPBUS Stable!! Missing green light!! 

PPBUS = 12.63V
PP3V42_G3H = 3.42V
PPVRTC_G3H = 3.1V
PP5V_S5 = 5V
PP5V_SUS = 5V 
PP5V_S3 = 0V - Diod Mode = 0.140v
PP5V_S0 = 0V - Diod Mode = 0.381v
PP5V_S0_HDD 0V Diod Mode = 0.379V


Already replace 51125 for a new one same history!!

title: 820 3115, no green light
message: PP3v3_S5 present? If so, check rails for shorts a common is PP5v_S3 audio caps which can cause the green light to have issues.

title: 820 3115, no green light
message: Check around U6900/01; start with SMC_BC_ACOK.

title: 820 3115, no green light
message:
JohnB8812 touch on the spot!! i have a partial short on PP5v_S3!! Diode mode i have 139v ... i have one working board and i have 439v on the line! 

i put 3v on this line and u7200 start to heat a little but i don't have others components heating!! i take off u7200 put the 3v and DC power don't consume (A)! 

SMC_BC_ACOK - floating 2.9 - 3.4 V 


any advice ?

title: 820 3115, no green light
message: Hmm do you still have no green light and no power after replacing U7200?

title: 820 3115, no green light
message: ya, i don't have green light yet... when i plug the charger i have a green light for 1 sec and then goes off!! already replace again u7200!! and noo changes!!

title: 820 3115, no green light
message:
Post voltages for U6900/01.
Check diode and small resistors from magsafe board; change it for test.

title: 820 3115, no green light
message:
U6900 

1- SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC = 3.340V - 3.484 Floating     [url]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ynHbGna1dnDmAm6pmcYCerOcK7DsGr9Z/view?usp=sharing[/url]
4 - SYS_ONEWIRE - 2.800V - 2.980V - Floating 
5 - ADAPTER_SENSE - 2.800V - 2.980V - Floating 

u6901 

1- SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC = 3.340V - 3.484 Floating
2-1- SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC = 3.340V - 3.484 Floating
4- SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC = 3.490V
5- =PP3V42_G3H_ONEWIREPROT - 3.340V - 3.484 Floating

With my experience when the voltages are floating on this case i think i have a short problem in some line!

title: 820 3115, no green light
message: Already replaced magasafe for a new on.. Replace q7260 and q7261 and PP5v_S3 now i have 439v on diode mode! Compare with a working board it's same value! but the board not turnin on and no green light!! i will check all trails for shorts!! =(

title: 820 3115, no green light
message:
All rails checked and not found any short's! As I was analyzing it was comparing with a working board and the values are similar (Diode mode)! 

Already replace U7000, by discharge same result's! With fake charge i have green light 1-2 sec goes orange and then goes green but  don't turn on.  

already replace U2600, by discharge to same results. SYSCLK_CLK32K_RTC = 32khz ! 

i have P5VS3_EN_L = 3.2V but Still missing PP5V_S3 = 0V. When i plug and unplug the charger i have this [url]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1GwNbkgMwoZEEibQfBGgRF11jPQn_8Vm_/view?usp=sharing[/url]

this one I would like to repair because it is from a new client and I think it's worth it because the board is clean. Does not look bad or touch from another guy! 

thanks

title: 820 3115, no green light
message:
"i have P5VS3_EN_L = 3.2V"
In fact 5V_S3 is not enabled!
That "_L" means something; active low, you need 0V there...

Post voltages for U7941.

title: 820 3115, no green light
message:
U7941 

1 - pp3v42_g3h_pwrctl - 3.42v
2 - smc_pm_g2_en - 3.4v
3 -p5v3v3_reg_en - 3.2v
4 - p3v3s5_en_l - 0v
5 - gnd
6 - pp3v3_s5_pwrctl - 3.3v 
7 - s5pgood_dly - 0v
8 - s5_pwrgd - 3.4v

title: 820 3115, no green light
message:
U7941 OK.
Check if PM_SLP_S4_L pulses at least; also check S3...

title: 820 3115, no green light
message:
whiling plug and unplug the mega safe, On PM_SLP_S4_L and PM_SLP_S3_L i have this ! [url]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1kq_y91of8WX3ZjJKAe0OhZsKcTkvGmxv/view?usp=sharing[/url] Can i consider a pulse?? 

I already check this board with scoop 10 times looking components knockouts ... and Board have good aspect! I don't have more SMC if not, i change again for discharge!

title: 820 3115, no green light
message: Much better to trigger SMC_ONOFF_L (simulating power button with R5015/16) and check any reaction at the moment.

title: 820 3115, no green light
message:
SMC_ONOFF_L When i short the pads 3.42V gos to 0V! 

i check PM_SLP_S4_L and PM_SLP_S3_L with oscilloscope and i don't have any pulse when i short the pads (R5015/16). 

SMC_BC_ACOK measuring with oscilloscope and ORIGINAL CHARGER: [url]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1DV2WhnrMhxXeyDlrknrVwCqS-xcZ9kXh/view?usp=sharing[/url]  Without original charger i don't have this oscillations. I do not know if this information is useful but i try my best! 

thanks

title: 820 3115, no green light
message:
"SMC_BC_ACOK" needs to be steady 3V (or close value); no need o-scope to check it.
You must put SMC_ONOFF_L to ground for an instance only, like when pressing power button; do NOT maintain ground contact.

title: 820 3115, no green light
message:
I don't see any reaction! =( 

i test with power supply and when i press the power button only consume 0.018A to 0.020A. 

already replace SMC for one i know it's working!! and same history,, 

could be PCH? 

I really needed this board repaired. so I because insist a little more .. thank you

title: 820 3115, no green light
message:
PM_PWRBTN_L reacts?
PM_RSMRST_L is steady 3V?
Do you have stable PPBUS_G3H and 3V42?

title: 820 3115, no green light
message:
PM_PWRBTN_L the only reaction i see it's the signal goes to 0v when i put SMC_ONOFF_L to ground for an instance. 

PM_RSMRST_L = 0V 

PPBUS_G3H and 3V42 are stable's! And in diode mode compare with a working board and shows same values! i still haven't green light with original charge only with fake! 

i have a perfect working board with me. it's possible we know if PCH is working well with measure points ??  

1 question we know PM_SLP_S4_L and PM_SLP_S3_L bought are pulsing, what does it mean?? i would like to understand!!

title: 820 3115, no green light
message:
"PM_RSMRST_L = 0V"
It MUST stay high at 3V.
Post U7930 voltages.
Try to start in SMC bypass mode.

title: 820 3115, no green light
message:
U7939 

pin1- PM_RSMRST_L = 0V
pin 2 - GND
pin3 - N.C - 3.3V
pin4 - S4_PGOOD_CT = 1.4V 
pin5 -  PP3V3_SUS_PWRCTL - 0.04V
pin6 - PP3V3_S5_PWRCTL - 3.3V

Don't star via SMC bypass mode!

title: 820 3115, no green light
message:
So you miss 3V3_SUS.
Do you also miss PM_SLP_SUS_L?
This one should appear before start the board.

title: 820 3115, no green light
message:
No i have PM_SLP_SUS_L = 3.3V stable! 

i noticed PP5V_S3 in diode mode i have 424v compare a working board i have 0.138v ... the problem can be here..already replace again this 2 components q7261 and q7260.  i already check the rails and no one missing! can e a component fault??



thank you

title: 820 3115, no green light
message: Then check Q7820/22, you are missing 3V3_SUS...

title: 820 3115, no green light
message: I do not know how to tell you this but while I was doing the measurements on Q7820 / 22, the comes to life without replace any component!!! i use a power supply to test boards, and when i see the current up to 900mA i'm WOW!!! This board repaired itself. in this type of situations what do you do ?? I have a lot of fear in these situations because the probability of coming back is high!

title: 820 3115, no green light
message: Check the solders for all the places you tocuhed before...

title: 820 3115, no green light
message: Nice one Mr.Vali!!! Thank you for your patience and insistence. Without your help I would not be able to repair this mac. you are a legend! in addition to being repaired I learned from you .. thanks one more time
